page.title: 09Peak District Mining Museum
page.content: The discovery in 1976 of a Trevithick designed water pressure engine in the Wills Founder head mine shaft at Winster,led to the opening of the{Peak {District Mining Museum}in 1978 - the result of work by the entirely volun- tary "Peak District Mines Historical Society".This museum is found in the Matlock Bath Pavilion.The museum illustrates 2000 years of Peak District lead mining.Exhibits illustrate geology,prospecting,survey- ing,mining law(unique to this area), tools,equipment,explosives,underhand and overhand stoping,transport,drain- ing,washing,dressing,smelting, the Mill-Close and Magpie mines and a simulated,climable mine-shaft for children.Audio-visual aids are used to illustrate mining features.The Temple mine,one of the few still worked for fluorite and lead is nearby.
